Hvis du deaktiverer donasjon knappene i popup, hÃ¥per jeg at du ogsÃ¥ vil stÃ¸tte Talkie pÃ¥ noen mÃ¥te! Knappene vil alltid vÃ¦re tilgjengelig her blant alternativene, bare i tilfelle.
frontend_hideDonateButtonsInPopupDescrip.original: It's not like I don't want you to get Talkie ðŸŒŸ Premium or donate to support Talkie and open source development in general - I just don't want you to be annoyed when using Talkie in the first place. If you disable the donation buttons in the popup, I hope that you will also support Talkie in some way! The buttons will always be available here among the options, just in case.

frontend_storyDescription.message: Talkie ble utviklet noen dager fÃ¸r nyttÃ¥r 2016/2017, pÃ¥ en utfordring fra en venn. Utfordringen startet med spÃ¸rsmÃ¥let: mens du pendler til arbeid, er det mulig Ã¥ lytte til en artikkel i stedet for Ã¥ lese den? Enkel, sa jeg, og satt ut for Ã¥ bevise det - eller i det minste Ã¥ gjÃ¸re nettleseren min snakke ut tekst ved hjelp av en dum datastemme. Den grunnleggende versjonen, uten noen brukergrensesnittet, viste seg Ã¥ vÃ¦re trivielt Ã¥ lage. Legge til et brukergrensesnitt, tok litt lenger. Legge til rette sprÃ¥kgjenkjenning en haug mer kode. Overvinne bugs i nettleseren enda mer arbeid. Listen over forbedringer og funksjoner gÃ¥r videre - og noen tusen linjer med kode senere, du ser pÃ¥ sluttresultatet.
frontend_storyDescription.original: Talkie was developed a few days before the New Year 2016/2017, on a challenge from a friend. The challenge started with the question: while commuting to work, is it possible to listen to an article instead of reading it? Easy, I said, and set out to prove it - or at least to make my browser speak out text using a silly computer voice. The basic version, without any user interface, turned out to be trivial to create. Adding a user interface, took a bit longer. Adding proper language detection a bunch more code. Overcoming bugs in the browser even more work. The list of improvements and features goes on - and a few thousand lines of code later, you're looking at the end result.

notAbleToSpeakTextFromThisSpecialTab.original: Talkie cannot access the selected text from this type of page. It is a very special page, and there are security limitations put in by the browser. You can also try to select text, then right click on it, and choose Talkie in the menu. I'm sorry for the inconvenience.
